messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Noam Chomsky on breaking out . . .
messages.msgSnippet: For those particularly interested, here s another link for critical thinking resources, including lots of ideas about helping children become critical thinkers
messages.messageBody:
For those particularly interested, here's another link for critical
thinking resources, including lots of ideas about helping children become
critical thinkers --

<A HREF="http://www.parentdirectededucation.org/thinking%20parent/The%20Thinking%20Parent.htm">The Thinking Parent at PDE</A>

Thanks to Lee sharing, maybe the Chomsky article will even show up
there at some point. :) JJ


ncfarms@... writes:


> Hello dear listmates-
>
> I have just finished reading a very thought-provoking interview with Noam
> Chomsky in the October issue of The Sun and wanted to pass along the
> following quote of Chomsky's from that article:
>
> "You have to be critical of whatever is presented to you in any media.
> Of
> course, the whole media system and the educational system are designed to
> drive critical thoughts from your mind. You're taught to be a passive,
> obedient follower. And unless you can break out of those habits, you'll be
> a victim of propoganda. But it's not that hard to break out."
>
> And, congratulations to each of you for breaking out - and for raising
> critical thinkers!
>
> Aloha, Lee
>
